sentence.Network_en: It is the dagger sent by the Mikado to her father with order to commit harakiri.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是一把天皇赐给他父亲命他剖腹自杀的短剑.

PerfectNetExp.abs: habutajo哈布塔绸harakiri 切腹自杀、hibacho碳火盆
...hakama 袴，日本和服裤裙（袴，はかま）harakiri 切腹（腹切り，はらきり）haiku 俳句，日本文学的一种（俳句，はいく）.

entry.tran: （旧时日本男子为免受羞辱而进行的）剖腹自尽
entry.def: In former times, if a Japanese man committed hara-kiri, he killed himself by cutting his own stomach open, in order to avoid dishonour.

means.word_mean: 1. ritual suicide by self-disembowelment on a sword; practiced by warriors in the traditional Japanese society

auth_sentence.content: During the samurai days, we just give you a knife and ask to you commit harakiri.
auth_sentence.res_content: During the samurai days, we just give you a knife and ask to you commit harakiri.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: During the samurai days, we just give you a knife and ask to you commit harakiri.
